restrictions.value: Non-eligible costs include activated own services, ongoing business operating costs, taxes, public fees, financing costs, and the acquisition of land and buildings. Projects without sustainable planning, companies outside defined business areas, or business premises not located in the ground floor zone are excluded.

application.value: Applications must be submitted online via Wirtschaftsagentur Wien. The funding application must be submitted BEFORE the project begins. The first-come-first-serve principle applies.

eligibility.value: Commercial and industrial production companies, production-related service providers of all company sizes, and startups.
Companies of all sizes, including startups (companies founded no more than one year prior to application).
Commercial and industrial production companies, and production-related service providers.

Companies planning to implement investment-related growth projects in Vienna, with consideration for climate neutrality. Projects must contribute to maintaining or expanding the company's employment level. A founding bonus of €5,000 is available for companies founded no more than one year prior to the application date. A women's bonus of €10,000 is granted if the project is demonstrably led by a qualified female employee, managing partner, or owner.

funding_details.value: A minimum of 50% own contribution is required, as the maximum funding rate is 50% of the recognized project costs.

Funds can be used for innovative and energy-efficient investments in machinery and equipment for manufacturing tangible goods or providing production-related services. Eligible costs include tangible and intangible investment costs (equipment, machinery, licenses), construction measures, material costs, personnel costs, and external services.
Both capital expenditures (tangible and intangible investments, construction measures) and operational expenditures (material costs, personnel costs, external services) are eligible.

timeline.value: The maximum project duration is 2 years.

geographic.value: Companies must be producing at the Vienna location. Projects must be implemented in a Viennese operating facility.

project.value: Innovative and energy-efficient investments.
Manufacturing of tangible goods or provision of production-related services.
Projects must consider climate neutrality and contribute to more energy-efficient production processes. Climate protection and environmental goals are key focus areas.

application.value: Applications must be submitted online. The funding application must be submitted BEFORE the project begins. Applications are subject to a competitive principle.

restrictions.value: Projects not implemented in a Viennese operating facility are excluded. Ineligible costs include activated own services, costs of ongoing business operations, taxes, public fees, financing costs, acquisition of land and buildings, and invoices for fundable costs under €200 net.

terms.value: Planned acquisitions should contribute to maintaining or expanding the company's employment level.

eligibility.value: Local supply and craft businesses with less than 50 employees and a maximum annual turnover of € 10 million, which primarily target end customers and have a local supply character with customer frequency. Founders planning to open a permanent business establishment in Vienna.
Founders (Gründer:innen) and established companies.

Companies belonging to the following categories of the Vienna Chamber of Commerce: Specialist Group and Division "Gewerbe und Handwerk" (Crafts and Trades) or "Handel" (Trade), or Specialist Group 601A or 601B (Gastronomy and Coffee Houses), the Division "Tourismus und Freizeitwirtschaft" (Tourism and Leisure Industry), or the Book and Media Trade branch of Specialist Group 708 (Book and Media Industry), the Division "Information und Consulting" (Information and Consulting).

Applicants must belong to one of the specified categories of the Vienna Chamber of Commerce. Founders must prove the establishment in Vienna no later than 6 months after the funding commitment. Projects must be in a business establishment in Vienna.

funding_details.value: Maximum funding rate: 50% of the recognized project costs. This implies a minimum 50% own contribution.

Fundable costs include personnel costs, construction measures, material costs, tangible and intangible investment costs (equipment, machinery, business furnishings, licenses), and external services (consulting, training, and marketing costs).

timeline.value: The maximum project duration is 2 years.

geographic.value: Companies must have their location in Vienna and projects must be carried out in a business establishment in Vienna.

project.value: Focus on innovative, energy-efficient investments in machinery and equipment, services, training, and external consulting. Investments are fundable if they follow the aspect of climate neutrality and are suitable for: producing or offering new products, introducing new technologies or establishing new production processes, contributing to efficiency increases, enabling manufacturing transfer or upscaling of prototypes.

Strengthening the dynamism and competitiveness, and preserving the diversity of the local supply sector and trade in Vienna. Focus on climate protection, environmental goals, ecologically sustainable investments, and employment.

restrictions.value: Companies without a local supply character are excluded. Projects concerning ongoing business operations are excluded. Companies not belonging to the defined industries are excluded. Non-fundable costs include activated own services, costs of ongoing business operations, taxes, public fees and financing costs, acquisition of land and buildings, and invoices with fundable costs under € 200 net.

application.value: Online submission via Wirtschaftsagentur Wien. The funding application must be submitted BEFORE the project begins. The competitive principle applies. The minimum assessment basis for recognized project costs is € 20,000.

eligibility.value: The funding application must be submitted before the start of the consulting services.
There must be no economic ties between the consulting company and the funding applicant.

funding_details.value: The program funds 75% of the net consulting fee, up to a maximum of 750 EUR, implying a minimum 25% own contribution.
Expert coaching for requesting necessary documents for the approval or modification of operating facilities.
Creation of operating descriptions or submission documents for operating facility approval.
Coordination of the creation of detailed projects by other specialists.
Coordination of submission documents with the competent authority.

timeline.value: The application period for the program is from January 2, 2025, to December 9, 2025.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Oberösterreich (Upper Austria).

project.value: Operating facilities, business founding, and business transfer.
Facilitating a rapid approval process for operating facilities.

restrictions.value: Travel expenses, per diems, and other disbursements are not eligible for funding.
Consulting services that commenced before the funding application was submitted are excluded.
Economic ties between the consulting company and the funding applicant are an exclusion criterion.

Unternehmen, die der gewerblichen Wirtschaft zugeordnet werden oder im Besitz einer aufrechten Gewerbeberechtigung sind.

funding_details.value: Mindestens 30 Prozent der Projektkosten müssen aus externen Kosten (externe Dienstleistungen, Sach- und Materialkosten und ähnliches) bestehen.

Kosten im Zusammenhang mit der Sondierung der technischen Machbarkeit sowie des wirtschaftlichen Potentials von Produkt-, Verfahrens- und Dienstleistungsentwicklungen; Entwicklung und Anbahnung von konkreten Innovations- und Technologieprojekten; Analyse der wirtschaftlichen und technischen Machbarkeit/Sinnhaftigkeit von Projektideen auch im Rahmen der Herstellung von Funktionsmustern; Anbahnung von Projektkooperationen; Bearbeitung von schutzrechtsrelevanten Fragestellungen (Patentrecherchen, Gutachten zur Bewertung des Patentpotentials in technischer und wirtschaftlicher Hinsicht)

geographic.value: Unternehmen mit Standort in Tirol; Projekte müssen innerhalb Tirols verwirklicht werden.

gewerbliche Wirtschaft; Kreativwirtschaft

Den Wissenschaftspartner:innen muss es grundsätzlich ermöglicht werden, Ergebnisse zu publizieren, sofern dadurch deren Schützbarkeit nicht gefährdet wird.

application.value: Anträge können laufend eingebracht werden. Hilfestellung und Beratung bei der konkreten Antragstellung bietet die Standortagentur Tirol GmbH. Die Einreichung erfolgt beim Amt der Tiroler Landesregierung, Abteilung Wirtschaftsstandort, Digitalisierung und Wissenschaft.

eligibility.value: Micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) with a location in Tyrol, which are assigned to the commercial economy or are in possession of a valid trade license.

funding_details.value: The funding is a maximum of 40% of the eligible costs, implying a minimum 60% own contribution from the applicant. At least 20% of the project costs must consist of external costs (external services, material costs, and similar).

legal.value: Applicants must be in possession of a valid trade license.

timeline.value: The project duration is a maximum of two years, with a minimum duration of 6 months, unless otherwise specified in the funding agreement.

geographic.value: Companies must have their location in Tyrol, and projects must be realized within Tyrol.

project.value: Development of market-ready new products, processes, or services; significant improvement of existing, already successfully introduced products, processes, or services; application of new technologies through technology transfer; feasibility studies to identify solutions for ideas in economic and technical terms.
Application of new technologies through technology transfer.

eligibility.value: Viennese training companies (Ausbildungsbetriebe gemäß § 2 Berufsausbildungsgesetz (BAG)) with a registered office or operating facility in Vienna.

Companies must be training apprentices in Vienna for the first time, or be training companies that have not trained apprentices in Vienna for at least five years. The program supports the new hiring of apprentices who reside in Vienna.

documents.value: Application documents (Antragsunterlagen) and a self-declaration from the company stating that no AMS funding according to the guideline for aid for the promotion of training relationships under the Vocational Training Acts has been claimed for the relevant apprenticeship.

funding_details.value: The funding covers costs under consideration of the basic federal funding (Basisförderung des Bundes).
Coverage of the costs for the apprentice's income (kollektivvertragliches Bruttolehrlingseinkommen zuzüglich 20 % Lohnnebenkostenpauschale) for the first year of the apprenticeship.

geographic.value: Viennese training companies with a registered office or operating facility in Vienna. Apprentices must have their residence in Vienna.

timeline.value: The funding covers the costs for the first year of the apprenticeship.

restrictions.value: Not eligible are: public bodies, federal training companies, political parties, and independent training institutions according to § 29, 30 and 30 b BAG. This funding excludes the use of the 'Wiener Lehrausbildungsbonus' and AMS funding according to the guideline for aid for the promotion of training relationships under the Vocational Training Acts.

application.value: Application documents must be submitted to the waff no later than three months after the end of the probationary period.

eligibility.value: Active member companies of the Economic Chamber Lower Austria (Wirtschaftskammer Niederösterreich)

Eligible to redeem the WK-Bildungsscheck are generally company owners, shareholders, managing directors, authorized signatories, persons registered in the company register, as well as co-entrepreneurs, partners, and children, provided there is a social insurance registration in the company.
Members of the Gastronomy/Hotel Industry professional group of the WKNÖ are eligible for an additional 200 Euro credit for WIFI-NÖ tourism events.

timeline.value: The main WK-Bildungsscheck has a validity period of three years.
The additional funding for Gastronomy/Hotel Industry members is valid for one year.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Lower Austria (Niederösterreich).

project.value: Additional funding is available for the Gastronomy/Hotel Industry sector, specifically for tourism-related WIFI-NÖ events.

funding_details.value: The education voucher can be redeemed for all training and further education events at WIFI Niederösterreich.

restrictions.value: For the additional funding for Gastronomy/Hotel Industry members, HACCP courses and courses on allergen labeling are excluded.
The additional funding for Gastronomy/Hotel Industry members is limited to the first 50 registrations.

eligibility.value: Applicants must be employees in the private sector with a fully insured employment relationship.
Applicants must have been employed by their current employer for at least 6 months with consistent normal working hours.
The weekly normal working hours must be reduced by at least 25% and at most 50%.
The agreed weekly normal working hours during the educational part-time period must not fall below 10 hours.
The employment relationship must still be remunerated above the marginal earnings threshold.
Applicants must demonstrably participate in a further education measure amounting to at least 10 hours per week or a comparable time commitment (e.g., during a study program).
For studies, proof of passing exams from compulsory and elective subjects totaling 2 semester hours or 4 ECTS points must be provided every 6 months (after each semester).

Alternatively for studies, other proof of success such as passing a diploma examination or rigorosum, or confirmation of progress and expected positive completion of a diploma thesis or other final paper, can be provided.

documents.value: Application for educational part-time allowance (Bildungsteilzeitgeld).

Agreement on educational part-time work, which must include: start, duration, and extent of part-time employment; previously performed working hours; number of employees in the company; and number of employees currently in educational part-time work.

timeline.value: Educational part-time can be completed within a total observation period of 4 years, for a maximum total duration of 2 years.
Each individual part of an educational part-time period must last at least 4 months.

geographic.value: The program is available for individuals and companies located in Niederösterreich (Lower Austria).

application.value: Users with an eAMS account can apply electronically. Applicants without an eAMS account must apply in person at their responsible regional AMS office.

funding_details.value: The funds are provided as 'Bildungsteilzeitgeld' (educational part-time allowance) to compensate for the income reduction due to decreased working hours while pursuing further education.

eligibility.value: Fulfillment of the entitlement to unemployment benefit.
An employment relationship of at least six months of uninterrupted duration must exist immediately before the start of the educational leave.
For seasonal workers, special regulations apply with a shorter uninterrupted employment period (3 months instead of 6 months) immediately before the start of the educational leave.
Proof of participation in an educational measure for at least 20 hours per week or a comparable time commitment is required.

If childcare responsibilities exist for a child under seven years of age, the educational measure must be attended for an average of at least 16 hours per week if no longer childcare option is available.
Proven learning and practice times are credited towards the required weekly hours for educational measures.

An agreement on educational leave according to §11 AVRAG (Employment Contract Law Adjustment Act) or a similar leave (e.g., according to federal or state regulations) must be made between the employer and employee.

If pursuing a university degree during educational leave, proof of passing exams totaling 4 semester hours per week or 8 ECTS points must be provided after each semester or every 6 months. Alternatively, other proof of success (e.g., passing a diploma examination or confirmation of progress on a thesis) can be provided.
Each individual part of an educational leave must last at least 2 months.

timeline.value: Educational leave can be concluded for a total duration of a maximum of one year within an observation period of four years.
Each individual part of an educational leave must last at least 2 months.

eligibility.value: Companies of all sizes (micro, small, medium, and large enterprises) with a location in Tyrol, which are assigned to the commercial economy or possess a valid trade license.

description.value: The 'Strategie.Impuls' program in Carinthia, Austria, offers strategic consulting support to businesses. The program supports the hiring of long-term unemployed persons.

The program targets employees who have completed at most compulsory schooling, female employees who have completed an apprenticeship or a vocational middle school, and employees who have reached 45 years of age and have a higher education than compulsory schooling.
The employment relationship must be fully insured or on leave (karenziert).
The further training must be relevant to the labor market and transferable between companies.

The further training must pursue one or more specified goals, such as a higher-value activity in the same workplace, a change to a higher-value workplace, improvement of basic competencies (e.g., German language skills, computer skills), completion of a certified training, professional specialization, securing employment for at least 6 months, or adapting to the current state of technology/knowledge.

The further training must last at least 16 hours, which must be conducted in person or live online. Mixed forms, e.g., with pure online course elements, are possible, but still require at least 16 hours in person or live online.
The further training must have been agreed upon between the company and its employee.

documents.value: An offer from the course provider must be submitted as part of the application. This offer must allow for the assignment of courses to a specific course format, clearly describing the components of the course (in-person course, live online course, online course) and whether it is an in-company live online course conducted exclusively for the company's employees by an external course provider. The offer must be in German or English, and the amount must be stated in Euros.

timeline.value: The further training must last at least 16 hours.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Oberösterreich (Upper Austria).

impact.value: The further training should contribute to a higher salary (higher collective bargaining group or an increase of at least 10%) or securing employment for at least 6 months.

application.value: Application and submission are done via the eAMS account. The complete application must be submitted at least 1 week before the start of the further training via the eAMS account.

Die Qualifikation des*der Innovationsassistent:in muss in einem plausiblen Zusammenhang mit dem Innovationsvorhaben und dem Unternehmen stehen. Der/die Innovationsassistent:in ist in ein unbefristetes, unselbstständiges und voll sozialversicherungspflichtiges Beschäftigungsverhältnis aufzunehmen. Gewerbliche Wirtschaft, Tourismus, Kreativwirtschaft, Start-Ups, Scale-Ups & Spin-Offs.

description.value: The "Impulsprogramm „Nah versorgt“ Niederösterreich" aims to strengthen regional local supply by improving the quality and appearance of businesses. It creates incentives for purchasing daily necessities locally, thereby reducing individual traffic in and around the region. The program supports the safeguarding of basic supply to enhance the quality of life in a municipality through the funding of investments in fixed assets.

eligibility.value: Small businesses in the commercial sector and municipalities within the framework of private-sector administration that carry goods for daily needs, including: retail food stores, bakeries, confectioneries, butchers, retail textile clothing, haberdashery and textile household goods stores, retail paper goods stores, retail shoe stores including orthopedic technology, retail drugstores and perfumeries, retail electrical, household and kitchen appliance stores (excluding the construction trade and audio/video sector).
Annual net turnover (in all business areas) must not exceed €2,500,000 per establishment.

Food retailers must offer a full range of groceries (bread and pastries, fruits and vegetables, milk and dairy products, eggs, sugar, rice, fats and oils, frozen goods, sausages, sweets, beverages, as well as cleaning and household items).
Opening hours must be at least 5 times a week.
Sales area must not exceed 500 m² per establishment.

technical.value: Electrically operated heat pumps must have a nominal thermal output of 100 kW or more.
Heat pumps must use ambient heat as a heat source (e.g., water/water or brine/water heat pumps).
The heat pump must be primarily designed for the provision of heating, hot water, process heat, or the supply of heating networks.
The refrigerant used in the heat pump must have a Global Warming Potential (GWP) of less than 2,000.
The annual performance factor (JAZ) of the heat pump system must be at least 3.8.

application.value: Application must be submitted by the company before the start of employment. The funding is tied to a mandatory consultation between the AMS and the applicant company regarding the person to be funded. Submission is made at the regional AMS office.

funding_details.value: Funds are provided as a subsidy towards the gross salary of the employed person.

restrictions.value: Marginal employment relationships are excluded.
Employment below 50% of the statutory or collective agreement weekly hours is excluded.

eligibility.value: Founders and acquirers of small businesses
Companies within 6 years of their founding or acquisition

No economic self-employment must have existed within the last 6 years prior to application. Previous minor self-employment (without GSVG compulsory insurance) does not constitute an exclusion from funding.

financial.value: The State of Upper Austria participates as a genuine silent partner.
If required, the house bank can additionally grant an interest-subsidized bank loan, with the possibility of securing it through the KGG.
The guarantee costs for the first three years are borne by the Upper Austrian Founder Fund of the State of Upper Austria.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Upper Austria.

project.value: Operating facilities, operating resources, company founding, company succession, start-ups, scale-ups, and spin-offs.

application.value: Submission of application to the Upper Austrian Founder Fund.

eligibility.value: Small and medium-sized commercial enterprises

financial.value: The UBG participates for a limited period as a genuine silent partner.

timeline.value: Duration and divestment procedures are individually agreed upon.

geographic.value: Companies must have their registered office in Upper Austria.

project.value: Operating facilities, operating resources, company formation, succession, local supply, start-ups, scale-ups & spin-offs, company handover.

eligibility.value: Applicants must be self-employed individuals or employees who personally pay for their education.
The highest qualification held by the applicant must be a Matura (high school diploma) or equivalent.
Self-employment must exist at the start of the educational measure.
Persons with a university or university of applied sciences degree are not eligible for funding.

funding_details.value: For preparation courses for apprenticeship, master, or qualification exams: up to 40% of course and exam fees, maximum €2,500.
For university or technical college courses, WIFI academies, foreman schools: up to 1/3 of course and exam fees, maximum €2,500.
For company-related specialized courses of at least 80 hours: up to 1/4 of course and exam fees, maximum €2,500.
Funds can be used to cover course and exam fees for eligible educational measures.

timeline.value: The program is valid until December 31, 2025.
Applications must be submitted no later than three months after the completion of the educational measure.

geographic.value: Applicants must be located in Vorarlberg.

project.value: Education and further training for employees and entrepreneurs, focusing on higher qualification.

restrictions.value: Persons who already hold a university or university of applied sciences degree are not eligible for this funding.

application.value: Applications must be submitted to Arbeiterkammer Feldkirch, Abteilung 'Bildungszuschuss', no later than three months after the completion of the educational measure.

eligibility.value: Ein-Personen-Unternehmen (EPU), which are fully GSVG-insured and are hiring their first employee for the first time or after a five-year period, within a genuine employment relationship.
The first employee must have recently completed an education and be registered as job-seeking with the AMS, or have been registered as unemployed with the AMS for at least 2 weeks.
The employment must be at least 50% of full-time.

Excluded employees include managing organs, apprentices, spouses, life partners, parents, grandparents, relatives up to the 2nd degree, step- and adopted children, freelance contractors, and new self-employed individuals.

financial.value: The grant covers 25% of the gross salary for 12 months, with an upper limit set by the ASVG maximum contribution base. If the employment relationship lasts less than one year, the subsidy is granted only for the duration of the employment.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Vorarlberg, Austria.

timeline.value: The funding is provided for 12 months, or for the duration of the employment if it is less than one year.

application.value: Applications must be submitted to the regional AMS office within six weeks after the start of the employment relationship.

funding_details.value: Funds can be used to cover the wage and ancillary wage costs of the first employee.

restrictions.value: The funding excludes managing organs, apprentices, spouses, life partners, parents, grandparents, relatives up to the 2nd degree, step- and adopted children, freelance contractors, and new self-employed individuals from being the first employee.

description.value: The Raiffeisenlandesbank OÖ business account is a modern and individual solution tailored to your specific needs, serving as the central hub for your financial management. With INFINITY, the Business Banking Portal, you can access your company accounts anytime, anywhere. It helps entrepreneurs separate business and private expenses and provides numerous applications to support financial management and simplify daily business operations.

eligibility.value: Entrepreneurs, small businesses, small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), and large businesses. Capital companies are legally obliged to maintain a business account.
For 'Smart' accounts: monthly account turnover less than approximately 150,000 Euro and few account bookings/transactions.
For 'Classic' accounts: monthly account turnover between approximately 150,000 and 450,000 Euro and not more than about 500 bookings/transactions per month.
For 'Pro' accounts: numerous (worldwide) transactions and regularly high account turnovers.
Utilization of a POS terminal (Kassa-Terminal) is required to qualify for the cash package discount.

geographic.value: Customers of Raiffeisenlandesbank OÖ, primarily serving businesses in Upper Austria, Austria.

funding_details.value: To manage daily financial transactions, separate business and private expenses, and build and manage operational liquidity reserves (via Cash-Konto Business).

restrictions.value: For 'Smart' accounts, monthly account turnover must be less than approximately 150,000 Euro.
For 'Classic' accounts, monthly account turnover must be between approximately 150,000 and 450,000 Euro, and transactions must not exceed about 500 per month.
Account model selection is based on individual or expected usage behavior, and changes in transaction volume or turnover may lead to a review of the optimal account model.

impact.value: Customers can receive a loyalty bonus and credit card bonus of up to 240 Euro annually, which can be redeemed on the findeR online marketplace.

geographic_eligibility.value: Customers and individuals based in Austria, particularly in Upper Austria (Oberösterreich).

eligibility.value: Privatpersonen, Einzelunternehmen, Erwerbsgesellschaften, Personen- und Kapitalgesellschaften, Genossenschaften, Vereine, Gemeinden und öffentlich-rechtliche Verbände
Projektträger müssen zu der jeweiligen Projekttätigkeit rechtlich befugt und zur Durchführung fachlich geeignet sein.

Projekte müssen mit dem regionalwirtschaftlichen Programm übereinstimmen und dürfen keine oder keine ausreichende Förderungsmöglichkeit im Rahmen bestehender Förderungsaktionen des Landes Tirol, des Bundes und/oder der EU haben.

geographic.value: Vorhaben müssen in folgenden Gemeinden der Planungsverbände Oberes Lechtal sowie Reutte und Umgebung realisiert werden: Bach, Breitenwang, Ehenbichl, Elbigenalp, Elmen, Forchach, Gramais, Häselgehr, Hinterhornbach, Höfen, Holzgau, Kaisers, Lechaschau, Musau, Namlos, Pfafflar, Pflach, Pinswang, Reutte, Stanzach, Steeg, Vils, Vorderhornbach, Wängle und Weißenbach. Das Förderungsgebiet der Leitmaßnahme „Stärkung der regionalen Wirtschaft im Bezirk Außerfern“ umfasst den gesamten Bezirk Außerfern.

Bach, Breitenwang, Ehenbichl, Elbigenalp, Elmen, Forchach, Gramais, Häselgehr, Hinterhornbach, Höfen, Holzgau, Kaisers, Lechaschau, Musau, Namlos, Pfafflar, Pflach, Pinswang, Reutte, Stanzach, Steeg, Vils, Vorderhornbach, Wängle, Weißenbach

Unternehmen, die unternehmerische Erfolge feiern wollen und eine Bank benötigen, die unternehmerisch denkt und handelt. Die Dienstleistungen konzentrieren sich auf die Bedürfnisse von Unternehmen und Institutionen.

financial.value: Die Laufzeit der Finanzierung ist an die wirtschaftliche Nutzungsdauer der finanzierten Sache anzupassen (Fristenkonformität).
Unternehmen behalten die volle Kontrolle über ihr Unternehmen und müssen keine Anteile an Investoren abgeben.

timeline.value: Die Laufzeit der Finanzierung ist an die wirtschaftliche Nutzungsdauer der finanzierten Sache anzupassen.

It is designed for existing and future members of the WKOÖ to support small and medium-sized commercial enterprises, as well as founders and successors of SMEs.

eligibility.value: Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), startups, or companies in the process of formation.
Applicants must have a concrete intention for commercial exploitation of the invention.

Research and experimental development (F&E).

Companies in the early growth stage, specifically Ein-Personen-Unternehmen (EPUs) hiring their first employee.

eligibility.value: Apprentices who are in an active apprenticeship relationship.
Apprentices whose apprenticeship relationship ended not longer than 6 months ago.

funding_details.value: The coaching is provided free of charge, implying no co-financing is required from the apprentice.

The coaching helps apprentices with questions or difficulties in their apprenticeship, at school or at home, if they decide to change something in their professional or private environment, or if they want to better organize their apprenticeship period.

geographic.value: The coaching services are offered Austria-wide.

project.value: The program focuses on supporting apprentices and vocational training.

restrictions.value: Coaching cannot be utilized if no active apprenticeship contract exists, if the apprenticeship ended more than six months ago, if training according to § 30 BAG is currently being completed, or if an inter-company training relationship currently exists without an impending switch to an apprenticeship company.

application.value: Registration for coaching is possible via the website www.lehre-statt-leere.at (email, appointment booking), through the Info-Line 0800 220074, or directly with the coaches.

eligibility.value: Companies and non-university research institutions, each with a location in Austria and activities in research and development in natural sciences or technology.
Internships are for female students in natural science and technical fields.

timeline.value: Internships must be between 1 and 6 months in duration.

geographic.value: Companies and non-university research institutions must have a location in Austria.

Activities must be in research and development in natural sciences or technology.

funding_details.value: Funds are to be used for high-quality internships in companies and non-university research institutions for female students in natural science and technical fields.

restrictions.value: Internships without a natural science or technical focus are excluded.
Internships without direct involvement in an FTI (Research, Technology, Innovation) activity are excluded.
Internships with a contract for work or a freelance service contract are excluded.
Internships at a university or university of applied sciences are excluded.

Dies umfasst umweltrelevante Investitionen bzw. energiesparende Maßnahmen in den Bereichen Haustechnik, Gebäudehülle, Druckluft-, Dampf-, Lüftungs- und Klimatechnik, Beleuchtung, Sonnenschutz, Verschattung, sowie energieeffiziente Antriebe, Maschinen und Anlagen.

Haustechnik, Gebäudehülle, Druckluft-, Dampf-, Lüftungs- und Klimatechnik, Beleuchtung, Sonnenschutz, Verschattung, Energieeffiziente Antriebe, Maschinen, Anlagen

Early stage (company founders), transition stage (company successors).
Specific professional groups including doctors, farmers, and liberal professions (e.g., pharmacists, architects, civil engineers, tax consultants).

application.value: Clients are encouraged to make an appointment for a personal consultation with Raiffeisen experts to discuss their needs and receive tailored offers and support.

Investments must be solid and financially sound, contributing to the sustainable success of the company.

financial.value: Financing solutions are adaptable to individual needs, with factors such as term and choice between fixed and variable interest rates influencing the terms.

timeline.value: The term (Laufzeit) is a factor in determining the financing solution.

geographic.value: Companies located in Oberösterreich (Upper Austria), served by Raiffeisenlandesbank Oberösterreich.

project.value: Investments in product extensions or improvements, operational rationalization, or expansion of service offerings are considered important factors for success.
Financing concepts are available for projects in real estate, energy, and housing construction.

impact.value: Investments are expected to sustainably secure business success and help companies gain competitive advantages.

application.value: Companies should arrange an appointment with a Raiffeisen advisor to discuss their project, clarify questions, and develop an optimal financing concept.

The suitability of a financing form depends on various factors, including the project's term and the choice between fixed and variable interest rates, as well as the solidity of the financial investment.

funding_details.value: Funds can be used for investment projects, including those in real estate, energy, and housing construction, as well as for product extensions or improvements, operational rationalization, expansion of service offerings, and working capital needs.
Both capital expenditures (Investitionsvorhaben) and operational expenditures (Betriebsmittelbedarf) are eligible for financing.

eligibility.value: Unternehmen, die auf den weltweiten Märkten tätig sind und Export- und Importgeschäfte tätigen oder Auslandsinvestitionen planen.

geographic.value: Unternehmen, die im internationalen Wettbewerb tätig sind und Geschäfte im Ausland tätigen oder planen. Die Raiffeisenlandesbank Oberösterreich ist in sieben europäischen Ländern stark vernetzt.

project.value: Innovative Lösungen für Finanzierung und Risikoabsicherung im internationalen Geschäft.

application.value: Interessierte Unternehmen können einen Termin mit einem Raiffeisenberater vereinbaren, um gemeinsam mit Auslandsexperten maßgeschneiderte Lösungen für ihre Auslandsgeschäfte zu erarbeiten.
Wirtschaftliche, rechtliche und politische Risiken im Exportgeschäft werden fundiert analysiert und abgewogen.

funding_details.value: Finanzierung von Export- und Importgeschäften, Finanzierung von Auslandsinvestitionen, Betriebsmittelkredite, Investitionsfinanzierungen, Schuldscheindarlehen, Avale, Absicherung von Währungs-, Zins-, Länder- und Ausfallsrisiken, sowie der Einsatz von Akkreditiven, Bankgarantien und Dokumenteninkassi.
Both capital expenditures (Investitionsfinanzierungen) and operational expenditures (Betriebsmittelkredite) are eligible.

Companies that want to address operational issues with labor market relevance, such as developing and retaining skilled workers, building and securing qualifications, maintaining employability, managing technological and structural change, or handling crises and capacity reductions.

funding_details.value: The consulting costs are fully covered by the AMS, meaning no own contribution is required.

Funds are used to cover the costs of organizational consulting services focusing on topics such as operational training, age-appropriate work, gender equality, securing jobs during capacity fluctuations, and fostering operational diversity and integration of labor market target groups.

timeline.value: The maximum duration of the consultation is 10 to 12 consulting days, depending on the company size, after an initial consultation.

geographic.value: Companies located in Tirol, Austria.

project.value: Thematic areas include operational training, age-appropriate work, gender equality, job security during capacity fluctuations, and shaping operational diversity/integration of labor market target groups.

application.value: The consultation process involves several phases: an initial meeting, an impulse check, impulse topic consultation, and impulse follow-up. For further information, companies should contact the AMS consultants at the Service for Companies in their regional office.

eligibility.value: Companies that are authorized to train apprentices according to the Vocational Training Act (BAG) or the Agricultural and Forestry Vocational Training Act (LFBAG).
The measure must have started after June 27, 2008.
The company bears the entire training costs, including travel and accommodation costs.
An active apprenticeship relationship must exist.
For preparatory courses for the apprenticeship examination, funding is available for measures up to a maximum of 6 months after the end of the apprenticeship.
The funded training time must have been credited to working hours.
The course participant must be able to present a certificate of participation for at least 75% of the course duration.
The calculated funding amount must be at least 30 EUR.

funding_details.value: 75 percent of the course costs excluding VAT are covered by the subsidy, implying a minimum 25% own contribution.

eligibility.value: Applicants must be apprentices.
Individuals whose apprenticeship ended a maximum of 36 months ago and who have worked at least one day in an apprenticeship company, meaning they have or had an apprenticeship contract.

documents.value: The funding application, including an invoice, certificate of attendance, and proof of payment, must be submitted by the apprentice.

funding_details.value: The funding covers 100 percent of the eligible costs.

Costs for additional vocational school classes due to repeating a vocational school year, preparatory courses for vocational school exams or the theoretical apprenticeship examination, tutoring courses at compulsory school level, compensation for collective agreement apprentice income during time off for repeating a vocational school class, and accommodation costs in a boarding school for up to one year after the end of the apprenticeship contract.

application.value: The funding application, including attachments, must be submitted by the apprentice's employer or an authorized person. Companies planning their entrepreneurial future, including those undertaking acquisition projects, expansions, business successions, management buy-outs, or management buy-ins.

financial.value: The financing term should be adapted to the economic useful life of the financed asset, ensuring conformity between the term of the corporate financing and the asset's lifespan.

timeline.value: Short-term financing is available for working capital (e.g., operating expenses). Medium- to long-term financing is available for investment credits (e.g., operating/business equipment, vehicle fleets) and leasing. Long-term financing is available for investment credits (e.g., business properties, renovation measures).

geographic.value: Companies based in Oberösterreich (Upper Austria), as offered by Raiffeisenlandesbank Oberösterreich.

project.value: Support for investments, international expansion, or the use of new technologies, particularly through 'Förderungen' (subsidies).
Real estate projects, export-oriented businesses, and general corporate investments.

funding_details.value: Funds can be used for: balancing sales fluctuations, utilizing discounts, financing working capital (Betriebsmittelkredit); pre-financing outstanding customer invoices (Factoring); financing successful real estate projects (Immobilienprojekt-Finanzierung); facilitating investments, international expansion, or the use of new technologies (Förderungen); acquiring operational/business equipment, vehicle fleets, or properties while preserving equity and assets (Leasing); and for acquisition projects, expansions, business successions, management buy-outs, or management buy-ins (Private Equity & Mezzaninkapital); and financing export receivables and orders (Exportfinanzierung).

Both capital expenditures (e.g., business/operating equipment, vehicle fleets, properties, renovation measures) and operational expenditures (e.g., ongoing operating costs, balancing sales fluctuations) are eligible for financing.
