Metallverarbeitende Betriebe (für Maschinenleasing)

eligibility.value: Users must be Raiffeisen customers with a valid debit or credit card to digitize their cards.
Users must have an Android smartphone for full functionality, including contactless payments and cash withdrawals.

technical.value: The RaiPay app is designed for use with any Android smartphone to enable convenient mobile payments.
For iOS devices (Apple), contactless payment and cash withdrawal functionalities are exclusively available through Apple Pay, while other RaiPay functions can be used without restriction.

geographic.value: The 'Send Money' function allows transfers to desired Austrian recipient cards, indicating a primary focus on users and transactions within Austria.

application.value: To use RaiPay, users must install the app, link it with their Mein ELBA account, and activate their digital cards for NFC payments with a single click. Payments are made by waking up the smartphone display and holding it to the payment terminal.

restrictions.value: Payment limits for transactions made with a mobile phone through RaiPay are identical to the limits agreed upon for the user's physical debit card.

eligibility.value: Companies that are authorized to train apprentices according to the Vocational Training Act (BAG) or the Agricultural and Forestry Vocational Training Act (LFBAG).
The apprentice must have been employed by the applicant company for at least the last 12 months before the end of the apprenticeship period.
The examination must have taken place in the learned apprenticeship profession.
The final apprenticeship examination must have taken place no later than 12 months after the end of the apprenticeship period.
The funding applies to the first attempt at the final apprenticeship examination.

documents.value: The funding application including all required attachments must be submitted by the training provider or an authorized person.

project.value: Apprenticeship training and vocational education.

restrictions.value: Public bodies, political parties, and educational institutions are not eligible for funding.

application.value: The funding application, including all required attachments, must be submitted by the training provider or an authorized person. The deadline for submitting an application is 3 months after the final apprenticeship examination has been completed.

eligibility.value: Research and development-oriented companies
Market-oriented research and development projects must be submitted by at least 2 companies from different Eureka member countries (or from an associated partner country).
Only Austrian project participants are funded by this program.

funding_details.value: Foreign project participants can be financed from their respective countries.

geographic.value: Companies must be based in Austria and collaborate with partners from Eureka member countries or associated partner countries.
Eureka-member countries or associated partner countries

project.value: Development of internationally marketable, research and technology-oriented products, processes, and services.
Open-themed projects with a natural science and technological background.

application.value: Applications are possible on an ongoing basis. Interested parties should contact the FFG experts at eureka@ffg.at.

restrictions.value: Projects must involve at least 2 companies from different Eureka member countries or associated partner countries.

eligibility.value: Companies that are authorized to train apprentices according to the Vocational Training Act (BAG) or the Agricultural and Forestry Vocational Training Act (LFBAG).

documents.value: The application form including attachments must be submitted by the training provider or an authorized person.

timeline.value: The deadline for application ends 3 months after the end of the respective apprenticeship year.

project.value: Apprenticeship training and personnel development.

application.value: The application is submitted by sending a correctly and completely filled out form by mail (sufficiently stamped), fax, or via the electronic application system LOS to the responsible apprenticeship office at the Chamber of Commerce of your federal state.

funding_details.value: The funding is provided for the training of an apprentice over one apprenticeship year, specifically to cover costs related to the apprentice's gross income as per collective agreements.

restrictions.value: Public bodies, political parties, and training institutions are not eligible for funding.

eligibility.value: Klein- und Mittelunternehmen (KMU) und wirtschaftlich tätige Vereine

Antragsstellung erfolgt durch ein Klein- und Mittelunternehmen (KMU) und wirtschaftlich tätige Vereine mit Betriebsstätte in Österreich im eCall der FFG, inklusive dem Angebot der wissenschaftlichen Forschungseinrichtung (FE), welche als Drittleister:in für das geplante Vorhaben tätig werden soll.

funding_details.value: Die Förderquote beträgt max. 80 %. Für eine Förderung in der Höhe von 10.000 Euro sind förderbare Projektkosten in der Höhe von 12.500 Euro erforderlich. Kosten unter 12.500 Euro werden aliquot unterstützt.

Forschungsbasierte Ideenstudien (wie beispielsweise Konzeptentwicklungen, thematisch und technologisch offene bzw. auch nicht technologische Vor- und begleitende Studien, Vorarbeiten für technologische Problemlösungen), Forschungsarbeiten zur Umsetzung innovativer Ideen, Vorbereitungsarbeiten für ein Forschungs-, Entwicklungs- und Innovationsvorhaben (inklusive Analysen zur Vollständigkeit von technischen Lösungsansätze sowie deren Ausarbeitung), Entwicklung von neuartigen Algorithmen und Methoden, Vorbereitung und Einleitung von patentierbaren Entwicklungen, Unterstützung bei der Prototypenentwicklung (z.B. Wissenschaftliche Begleitung bei der Durchführung von Funktionstests und anschließenden Optimierungsarbeiten), Konzepte für technisches Innovationsmanagement (proof-of-concept).

geographic.value: Companies and economically active associations with a business establishment in Austria.

application.value: Die Einreichung erfolgt online im eCall der FFG.

restrictions.value: Bei vorsteuerabzugsberechtigten Klein- und Mittelunternehmen wird die Umsatzsteuer nicht als Kostenfaktor angesetzt.

eligibility.value: Companies that are authorized to train apprentices according to the Vocational Training Act (BAG) or the Agricultural and Forestry Vocational Training Act (LFBAG).
Regional authorities, political parties, and training institutions are not eligible for funding.

documents.value: A correctly and completely filled application form, including all necessary attachments, must be submitted.

funding_details.value: Applicants must contribute 25% of the course costs, excluding VAT, as the program covers 75%.

Funds can be used for measures serving the further training of trainers in dealing with apprentices, with a minimum duration of 8 hours. Examples include pedagogy, methodology, didactics, or personal development.

timeline.value: Application must be submitted within 3 months after the completion of the training measure.

geographic.value: Companies located throughout Austria are eligible.

project.value: Increasing the quality of apprenticeship training.
Education and further training for employees, specifically apprentice trainers.

restrictions.value: Specialized technical courses are not eligible for funding.

application.value: Applications can be submitted electronically via the Lehre.Fördern-Online-Service (LOS), by email with TLS 1.2 or higher encryption and an unencrypted scanned attachment (completed application form), by fax, or by postal mail with a correctly and completely filled form.

eligibility.value: Companies that are authorized to train apprentices according to the Vocational Training Act (BAG) or the Agricultural and Forestry Vocational Training Act (LFBAG).
The apprenticeship relationship must have been established on or after June 1, 2013.
The apprentice must have completed their 18th year of life at the beginning of the apprenticeship relationship.
If applicable, the regulation on shortened apprenticeship periods (VO 201/97 for graduates of apprenticeships, AHS, BMHS) was applied.
The apprenticeship relationship must have been maintained throughout the entire apprenticeship year (or ended regularly due to time expiry or final apprenticeship examination).

At least the remuneration for auxiliary staff according to the collective agreement, or – if no collective agreement applies – in the amount of the reference value, must have been paid throughout the entire apprenticeship year.

A self-declaration from the company must be available stating that no AMS funding (funding for the apprenticeship training of adults, i.e., those over 18 whose employment problem can be solved by an apprenticeship due to quality deficiencies) was claimed for the apprenticeship relationship.
No apprenticeship in a related apprenticeship profession, a BMS in the specialist area of the apprenticeship profession, or a BHS has been completed yet.

funding_details.value: The funding is for the training of an apprentice over one apprenticeship year, who was 18 or older at the beginning of the apprenticeship contract.

timeline.value: The funding is granted for the duration of one apprenticeship year.

application.value: The funding application, including attachments, must be submitted by the authorized training company or an authorized person. Applications can be submitted electronically via the Lehre.Fördern-Online-Service (LOS), by email with TLS 1.2 or higher encryption and an unencrypted scanned attachment of the completed application form, by fax to the number indicated on the application, or by post with a correctly and completely filled-out form.
Funding application including attachments, completed application form.

restrictions.value: Public bodies, political parties, and training institutions are not funded.
No AMS funding (funding for the apprenticeship training of adults) can be claimed for the same apprenticeship relationship.

eligibility.value: All company and project sizes. Any natural person or organization (outside of federal administration; excluding private universities).
Applicants must be planning a research and development project. Only organizations outside of federal administration are eligible.

funding_details.value: Funding covers up to 50% of project costs for most companies, and up to 70% for company founders. This implies a minimum own contribution of 50% and 30% respectively.
All costs directly related to the project are eligible for funding, including personnel costs and material costs.

financial.value: Loans are offered at favorable interest rates.

geographic.value: Companies and organizations located throughout Austria.

project.value: Projects must be market-relevant, involve a high degree of difficulty and risk, and demonstrate realistic economic exploitation perspectives.

application.value: Applications can be submitted at any time electronically via the FFG's eCall system.

eligibility.value: Applicants must be able to self-finance a certain share, with the equity share required to be at least 20 percent, according to regulations valid since 2022.

documents.value: Necessary information for any external financing includes a household budget plan, salary slips, a list of assets, liabilities, and insurances. For real estate financing, precise documents for the property itself are required, such as the current land register extract, the purchase agreement, possibly an appraisal report, the building plan of the house or apartment, the calculation of construction costs, and for the purchase of an existing apartment, the current operating cost statement or the annual statement from the property management with a list of reserves formed.

financial.value: The repayment rate for housing loans is individually adjusted to personal situations, allowing for flexible durations and the possibility of agreeing on grace periods. Building savings financing offers a free interest rate cap for up to 20 years from the allocation of the building savings loan. Applicants can choose between a variable interest rate and a fixed interest rate for 10 or 20 years.
The equity share must be at least 20 percent of the financing amount.
For the registration of a mortgage in the land register, a fee of 1.2 percent of the amount to be registered is incurred.

legal.value: The most significant security for building or buying a house or acquiring an owner-occupied apartment is the pledging of the property, known as a mortgage, which is entered in the land register.

timeline.value: Loan durations can be individually designed. Building savings loans offer an interest rate cap for up to 20 years from allocation.

geographic.value: Companies and individuals based in Austria, specifically served by Raiffeisenlandesbank Oberösterreich, are eligible. Raiffeisen real estate agents are represented throughout Austria.

project.value: The financing is focused on real estate projects, including residential properties (house construction, apartment purchase, renovation) and commercial properties (erecting or buying commercial real estate, developing existing objects, or investing in new properties).

application.value: Applicants are encouraged to arrange a non-binding consultation appointment with Raiffeisen advisors who will support them in selecting the optimal financing solution according to their needs. Advisors also assist with the entire process, from application submission to the disbursement of funding, and provide guidance on all housing-related questions.

funding_details.value: Funds can be used for house construction, apartment purchases, renovations, erecting or buying commercial properties, developing existing properties, or investing in new properties.

restrictions.value: According to regulations valid since 2022, the equity share for real estate financing must be at least 20 percent.

eligibility.value: Private individuals and households investing in energy-efficient home renovations and housing projects.

financial.value: For Bausparfinanzierung, loan terms up to 35 years are possible, with a free interest rate cap for up to 20 years from the allocation of the building savings loan. For Wohnkredit, flexible loan terms can be individually designed, and repayment-free periods can be agreed upon, with a choice between fixed and variable interest rates.

geographic.value: Individuals and households based in Austria, specifically in the context of Raiffeisenlandesbank OÖ.

funding_details.value: Investments in one's own home, such as the acquisition of solar thermal systems for hot water preparation, heat recovery systems for bathing and showering, decentralized water stations, hot water storage tanks with double insulation, energy-efficient windows and doors, insulation of upper floor ceilings, ground floor, and basement, digital thermostats, facade insulation, heat recovery for ventilation, and fireplaces.

project.value: Residential housing, home renovation, energy efficiency.

eligibility.value: Consortium consisting of at least 4 companies, with a minimum of 3 being small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).

A consortium of at least 4 companies must be formed, of which at least 3 must be small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). Collaborations between companies and research institutions are also possible. Projects with total costs below €100,000 are not eligible for funding.

funding_details.value: Minimum 40% own contribution of eligible costs, as the grant covers a maximum of 60% of eligible costs.
Costs for establishing the cooperation, including personnel costs and other project-related individual costs such as travel expenses, material costs, and other project-related expenses.

restrictions.value: A consortium of at least 4 companies must be formed, with a minimum of 3 being small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). Collaborations between companies and research institutions are also possible within the consortium.
Projects with total costs below €100,000 are not eligible for funding.

project.value: Focus on improving the innovation capability of companies through technology and knowledge transfer, and building/strengthening research and development-oriented cooperations.
Research and development-oriented cooperations and networks between companies.

application.value: Applications are submitted based on a call principle and are subject to specific deadlines. The respective submission deadlines must be inquired about with the contact persons.
The selection of eligible projects is made by a jury.

eligibility.value: Individuals and households seeking to buy, sell, rent, let, build, or renovate real estate.

financial.value: Individual financing and repayment plans are developed with advisors.

funding_details.value: Advisors assist in optimally utilizing all available subsidies and funding.
Property purchase, sale, rental, building, or renovation of real estate.

geographic.value: Customers of Raiffeisenlandesbank Oberösterreich (Upper Austria).

application.value: Customers contact advisors to develop a personalized financing and repayment plan. Advisors assist with the entire process, from application submission to the disbursement of funding.

eligibility.value: Applicants must hold Austrian citizenship or be equally entitled.

The household's family income must not exceed a specified upper limit, which varies by federal state and is based on the gross or net annual income of the previous year (excluding family benefits, but allowing for deductions for advertising costs and extraordinary burdens).
The object (house/apartment) must be eligible for funding.
The applicant must establish their main residence in the funded property.
Social need is a decisive factor in the allocation of funding.

financial.value: A subsidized loan (Förderdarlehen) for new construction of owner-occupied homes and terraced houses offers an attractive fixed interest rate of 1.50% for the first 20 years, followed by a variable interest rate with quarterly adjustments.
The loan has a long term of 35 years to keep monthly repayments as low as possible.
Annuitätenzuschüsse (annuity subsidies) are available as contributions towards the repayment of building society or bank loans.

geographic.value: Funding is primarily focused on Oberösterreich (Upper Austria), with specific guidelines varying across the individual federal states of Austria.

project.value: The energy-saving principle plays a crucial role; those who implement energy-saving measures receive more funding.
Residential construction (new builds, renovations, extensions), purchase of houses and apartments, and general housing projects.

application.value: Raiffeisen advisors provide comprehensive funding consultation for investments, supporting clients from the application process through to the disbursement of funding, and assisting with all housing-related questions.
Advisors work with clients to develop a financing and repayment plan that optimally utilizes all available subsidies.

funding_details.value: Funds can be used for building, renovating, extending, and purchasing houses and apartments, as well as for implementing energy-saving measures.
Specific funding is available for the new construction of owner-occupied homes and terraced houses.

eligibility.value: Companies with a business location in Salzburg

A specific, independent, and product-neutral consultation, considering the company's overall energy situation, must be conducted by a consultant from umweltservicesalzburg.at (Photovoltaic-Check for businesses) or another authorized company.
Technical system planning must be carried out by a company authorized to install photovoltaic systems before applying for the funding.

financial.value: The funding is provided as a non-repayable direct grant.

geographic.value: Companies with a business location in Salzburg, Austria

project.value: Photovoltaic systems and electricity storage units
Reduction of CO2 & other environmental pollutants

impact.value: Reduction of CO2 and other environmental pollutants
Increasingly covering electricity demand from renewable energy

application.value: A specific, independent, and product-neutral consultation must be conducted, considering the company's overall energy situation, by a consultant from umweltservicesalzburg.at (Photovoltaic-Check for businesses) or another authorized company. Additionally, a technical system planning must be carried out by a company authorized to install photovoltaic systems before applying for the funding.

funding_details.value: Establishment and expansion of photovoltaic systems and electricity storage units on commercially used buildings or, in exceptional cases, on the land parcels of the building-approved buildings.

eligibility.value: All employers are eligible to receive this subsidy. Excluded from the subsidy are the Public Employment Service (AMS), political parties, political party clubs, radical associations, and the federal government.

The employment relationship of registered unemployed persons aged 45 and older can be subsidized. Also eligible are job seekers who have been registered as unemployed for at least 6 months (for persons under 25 years) or 12 months (for persons aged 25 years and older). Under certain conditions, the subsidy can also be granted to persons acutely threatened by long-term unemployment, such as re-entrants or training graduates with a lack of practical operational experience. Regionally different age limits may be subsidized.

timeline.value: The duration of the subsidy is agreed upon individually between the AMS and the employer, depending on labor market policy requirements.

project.value: The program focuses on staffing and personnel employment.

application.value: The subsidy is tied to a consultation between the AMS and the employer regarding the person to be subsidized. This requires that the applicant contacts the responsible advisor at the regional AMS office before the start of employment.
The amount and duration of the subsidy are determined on a case-by-case basis according to labor market policy requirements, agreed between the AMS and the employer.

funding_details.value: Funds are provided as a subsidy for wage costs.

restrictions.value: Regionally different funding conditions and requirements are possible.

description.value: This page provides relevant tax and legal information concerning the purchase, sale, and rental of apartments and houses. It aims to help users understand the complexities of real estate regulations and offers tips. Raiffeisen's real estate agents and financial advisors are available to provide further consultation and information on financing options.

geographic_eligibility.value: Our real estate agents are represented throughout Austria and also near you.

application.value: Interested individuals can arrange a consultation ('Beratungsgespräch vereinbaren') with Raiffeisen's experts.

geographic.value: The magazine covers the nationwide Austrian real estate market.

application.value: Customers can order a free physical copy of the magazine by sending an email with their name and postal address to office@raiffeisen-immobilien.at.

eligibility.value: Small businesses in the commercial sector that are members of the Salzburg Chamber of Commerce and employ an average of no more than 20 employees (excluding apprentices, converted to full-time equivalents) per year.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Salzburg, Austria.

project.value: Investments that contribute to the sustainable safeguarding and strengthening of competitiveness and innovative capacity; offering new or improved products or services or applying new production processes.
Commercial sector, including tourism and leisure businesses.

funding_details.value: Structural and mechanical improvements and/or expansions; offering new or improved products or services or applying new production processes; in tourism and leisure businesses, contributing to season extension, attracting new target groups, improving operational quality, or creating/improving accommodation and/or common rooms for employees. Intangible investments are only eligible if they are necessary for the use of tangible assets, with the tangible asset being the primary focus.

restrictions.value: Vehicles primarily intended for transport (trucks, delivery vans, cars, taxis, bicycles) are not eligible. Investments that have already commenced (i.e., ordered/commissioned) before the submission of the application cannot be funded.

application.value: Applications must be submitted exclusively online to the state authority.

eligibility.value: Individuals who are founding a business for the first time or taking over a business (up to a maximum of 3 years after founding/takeover).
Early stage, startup, or young entrepreneurs (up to 3 years after founding/takeover).
For companies, at least one shareholder must be self-employed for the first time, hold over 50% of the shares, and be authorized to manage the business.

funding_details.value: A minimum 25% own contribution is required, as 75% of the net consulting costs (excluding VAT) are funded.

Funds can be used for further business management support by business consultants to address specific problem areas such as cost and profit planning, minimum turnover determination and hourly rate calculation, financing and bank negotiations, budget planning, marketing questions and concepts, and support in developing the entire business concept.

geographic.value: Companies located in Vorarlberg, Austria.

project.value: Business founding, business transfer, and business valuation.

application.value: Submission of the application must occur before the consultation service is utilized.

eligibility.value: Individuals who are immediately prior to a business transfer.
Business transferees who no longer fall under the young entrepreneur guidelines of the state of Vorarlberg.
For companies, if, after a successful transfer, at least 75% of the company shares are held by the transferee.
For transferees who held no more than 25% of the company shares before the takeover.
For transferees who are entering an industry in which they have not previously been active.

funding_details.value: For Modul 1 'Nachfolge-Check': 75% subsidy of net consulting costs, implying a minimum 25% own contribution.
For Modules 2 to 4: 50% subsidy of net consulting costs, implying a minimum 50% own contribution.

Further business support for the preparation and implementation of a business idea by management consultants, addressing specific problem areas. Eligible consulting modules include: Module 1: Succession Check, Module 2: Company Valuation, Module 3: Creation of a Transfer Concept and Support for the Transfer, Module 4: Mediation.

geographic.value: Companies and individuals located in Vorarlberg, Austria.

project.value: Business succession, business transfer, company valuation, and mediation related to business transfers.

application.value: Application must be submitted before the consulting service is utilized.

eligibility.value: All companies that have employment relationships with their employees based on a private law contract and fall within the scope of the Labor Contract Law Adaptation Act (AVRAG), or those based on a public law contract if a federal or state law regulation analogous to the AVRAG on the reduction of normal working hours is created.
Excluded from funding are the Public Employment Service (AMS), political parties, and radical associations.

funding_details.value: Companies must cover at least 50% of the lost wages due to reduced working hours, as the subsidy covers a maximum of 50% of the lost wages and additional social security contributions.

Funds can be used to subsidize the employment relationships of employees who reduce their normal working hours by up to 50% under a solidarity premium model, and to cover additional employer and employee contributions to statutory social insurance.

timeline.value: The subsidy is granted for the duration of the agreed solidarity premium model, up to two years. If a replacement worker is hired who is long-term unemployed, older than 45 years, or disabled, the subsidy can be granted for three years.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Tirol. The competent AMS office is determined by the location of the personnel-managing unit of the company where the employees to be funded are employed.

restrictions.value: The Public Employment Service (AMS), political parties, and radical associations are excluded from funding. The AMS has a limited annual budget for the solidarity subsidy; once exhausted, no further subsidies for new models can be approved, even if eligibility criteria are met.

description.value: This page provides an overview of various awards and certifications received by Raiffeisenlandesbank OÖ, recognizing its quality as an employer, customer service provider, and commitment to ESG principles. The bank strives for continuous improvement beyond legal requirements through internationally recognized guidelines. This page does not describe a funding program or financial offering for external applicants.

eligibility.value: Food retailers (full-range supermarkets) with an annual turnover of up to Euro 2.5 million and a sales area of max. 400 m².
For operating cost subsidies, the business must be located in an area where no other full-range food business exists.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Vorarlberg.

funding_details.value: Investments by food retail businesses are eligible.
Delivery services for communities with endangered food supply, performed regularly (at least twice a week), are eligible.

application.value: Applications must be submitted before the start of the investment.
Applications are submitted to the Vorarlberger Landesregierung, Abtg. VIa, 6901 Bregenz.

eligibility.value: Small and medium-sized accommodation businesses with up to 50 employees
Federal funding, if possible, must be utilized first. Therefore, it must first be checked whether the Austrian Hotel and Tourism Bank (ÖHT) funds the project.
The investment volume recognized as eligible by the ÖHT must not exceed € 700,000.

restrictions.value: The purchase of land and buildings is not funded.
The acquisition of vehicles of all kinds is not funded.
The state funding can be claimed once within two years.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Vorarlberg, Austria.

An additional grant of 5% of the funded financing volume is awarded if the investment location is in Blons, Brand, Bürserberg, Dalaas, Fontanella, Innerbraz, Klösterle, Raggal, St. Gerold, Silbertal, Sonntag, Thüringerberg, Schröcken or Warth.

funding_details.value: Investments that meet at least two of the following criteria: increasing the company's performance, adapting to market requirements, quality improvement through renovations and extensions (e.g., creation or modernization of guest rooms, dining areas including entrance, sanitary facilities, staff facilities), investments in operational infrastructure, and investments serving target-group-specific marketing, expansion of event facilities (e.g., seminar and conference rooms with technical equipment), capacity adjustment in connection with optimizing operational size, accessibility measures, child-friendly measures (e.g., children's playgrounds), investments for significant reduction of energy consumption, investments for increasing guest safety (e.g., fire protection measures).

application.value: Applications must be submitted before the start of the investment to the Vorarlberg State Government, Dept. VI a, 6901 Bregenz. If the project is not eligible for funding by the ÖHT, an application can be submitted immediately to the State of Vorarlberg.

financial.value: Advisors assist in developing a financing and repayment plan tailored to individual needs.

geographic.value: Individuals and entities in Austria, specifically served by Raiffeisenlandesbank Oberösterreich.

application.value: Applicants consult with Raiffeisen advisors who assist in developing a financing and repayment plan, optimizing the use of available funding, and managing the application process from submission to disbursement of funds.

funding_details.value: Funds can be used for house construction, apartment purchases, or renovations.

eligibility.value: Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) that have the potential to grow strongly internationally through the implementation of an innovative idea.
The company must apply alone but can be supported by others during project implementation.
Only profit-oriented SMEs can apply for funding.

funding_details.value: 70% of direct costs and 25% of overhead costs of the innovation project are funded.
Funds can be used for the implementation of prototypes to market readiness and subsequent scale-up activities.
Funds can be used for all innovation activities of a business plan leading to a market-ready product/service and subsequent scale-up of the company.

financial.value: An equity share of up to €15 million is available for scale-up after market readiness, with participation up to a maximum of 25%.

project.value: Implementation of an innovative idea with potential for strong international growth, focusing on prototype development to market readiness and subsequent scale-up.
Implementation of all innovation activities from a business plan towards a market-ready product/service and subsequent scale-up of the company.

application.value: The application must be submitted in English, and it is recommended to contact the FFG (Austrian Research Promotion Agency) in advance.

restrictions.value: The innovation project can originate from research but does not have to (e.g., business model innovation). The projects are primarily about implementation, not research.

eligibility.value: Individual researchers, companies, or research communities
Projects must be supported by federal funding institutions (e.g., Forschungsförderungsgesellschaft FFG).

funding_details.value: The funding supplements federal contributions (grants, loans) by up to 25%.

financial.value: Partial or full assumption of interest for loans from federal funding institutions.

project.value: Development of new products, services, and processes.

geographic.value: Applicants must have their headquarters in Vorarlberg.

timeline.value: The program is valid until December 31, 2025.

application.value: Applications must be submitted no later than 1 month after receiving federal funding approval.

restrictions.value: Projects must be exploited/utilized within the state of Vorarlberg.

eligibility.value: Members of the 'Lebensmittelhandel' (food retail) committee of the Salzburg Chamber of Commerce, or members of the 'Bäcker' (bakers) or 'Fleischer' (butchers) guilds, provided they fulfill a core local supply function in a municipality where no full-service food retailer exists.
Companies must have a maximum of ten business locations.
Annual turnover from food sales must not exceed 5 million Euro.
Sales area must not exceed 600 m² (pure food sales area).
Must offer a complete food assortment.
Must demonstrate economic independence.
Micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs)
Companies must have their operational headquarters in the State of Salzburg.
Large enterprises are excluded from this funding program.
Projects that have already started before the submission of the application cannot be funded.

Funding can only be granted if the applicant cannot utilize existing federal funding programs for new business formations and takeovers, or if these funding opportunities were insufficient, to prevent double funding.

documents.value: Application form of the State of Salzburg

funding_details.value: The grant covers 40% of the eligible costs, implying a minimum 60% own contribution from the applicant.
Funds can be used for organizational development, personnel development, and modern forms of work.

timeline.value: The program is valid until December 31, 2025.

geographic.value: Companies must have their operational headquarters in the State of Salzburg, Austria.

project.value: Innovation in work environments, specifically 'Arbeitswelt 4.0' (Work 4.0).

compliance.value: No double funding is permitted with existing federal funding programs for new business formations and takeovers.

impact.value: The program aims to motivate companies to create attractive working conditions under which employees can better develop their performance and contribute to work processes in all life phases and situations.

application.value: Applicants must submit the application form of the State of Salzburg.

restrictions.value: Large enterprises are not eligible for funding.
Projects whose implementation began before the submission of the funding application cannot be funded.
Double funding with existing federal funding programs for new business formations and takeovers is not permitted.

description.value: This program offers a subsidy for self-financed, credit-financed, and leasing-financed investment projects for young entrepreneurs in Vorarlberg. It aims to support business founders and successors during the start-up phase. The funding covers various investments and initial expenses related to business establishment or takeover, with a focus on fostering new businesses and facilitating business transfers.

eligibility.value: Einzelunternehmer (sole proprietors)
GesmbH's (limited liability companies), provided the young entrepreneur holds at least 51% of the shares

funding_details.value: The program provides a subsidy of 10% for investments between €10,000 and €50,000, implying the remaining amount must be self-financed, credit-financed, or leasing-financed.

timeline.value: Application must be submitted before the start of the investment and up to 1 year after founding or taking over the business.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Vorarlberg, Austria.

project.value: Support for business founders, business successors, start-ups, scale-ups, and spin-offs, as well as business transfers.

restrictions.value: Already completed investments are excluded.
Investments that can be funded by the federal government are excluded.

eligibility.value: Small gastronomy businesses (Kleine Gastronomiebetriebe)
Businesses must have an appealing food and beverage offering.
Federal funding must be utilized first if possible; therefore, it must first be checked whether the Austrian Hotel and Tourism Bank (ÖHT) funds the project.
The investment volume recognized as eligible by the ÖHT must not exceed €700,000.
If the project is not eligible for funding from the ÖHT, an application can be submitted directly to the State of Vorarlberg.

funding_details.value: The grant is a one-time subsidy for investments financed by credit, leasing, or own funds, implying co-financing for the total investment is required.

funding_details.value: The grant covers 70% of external consulting costs for 'Impulsberatung' and 50% for 'Sustainable Corporate Management', 'Environmental Management Systems', and 'Environmental and Climate Protection' modules.

Funds can be used for qualified external consulting services, specifically for impulse consulting and consulting on modules such as Sustainable Corporate Management, Environmental Management Systems, and Environmental and Climate Protection. The maximum eligible hourly rate for consultants is 100.00 Euro (net) including incidental costs.

geographic.value: Companies must be located in Styria, Austria.

project.value: Finding and strengthening sustainable and environmentally relevant strategies.
CSR & Sustainability, operational environmental protection, environmental management systems (EMAS/ISO/IMS), climate protection (energy mobility, resources).

restrictions.value: Measures must not have commenced before the application is submitted.

Consulting services for the implementation of occupational safety regulations and for the investigation and evaluation of psychological stress at the workplace, including the definition of improvement measures. This focuses on assessing working conditions (workplace, activity) in terms of relational prevention, not individual or group coaching.

financial.value: The WKBG takes temporary minority participations with a term between 5 and 10 years. The participant is entitled and obliged to repay or otherwise divest the participation held by WKBG within the contractual provisions. Participation costs consist of several fixed and variable elements, such as a minimum return (oriented towards the usual capital market return plus risk premium), processing fee, and examination and control fee.

eligibility.value: Innovative, technology- and growth-oriented production companies in the industrial-commercial sector and innovative business-related service companies, especially those in the key themes and core competencies in Styria.

The product or service of the applicant must be placeable on international growth markets and have an expandable competitive advantage/USP. The company management must demonstrate sufficient technical, commercial, and marketing-specific qualifications. The project must be fully financed upon granting of the participation.

financial.value: For a typical silent partnership: a fixed profit in advance plus a variable profit-dependent additional remuneration; loss participation is excluded. For an atypical silent partnership (=equity): share in the increase in value of the company (company value and hidden reserves) plus a share in the annual company profit/loss.

geographic.value: Companies based in Styria, Austria.

description.value: Raiffeisen has been supporting communities and associations ("WIRs") in Austria for over 130 years, embodying its cooperative philosophy. This engagement extends to various areas including culture, education, social causes, ecology, and sports, reflecting Raiffeisen's commitment to social responsibility. The bank also offers personal financial advisory services for wealth accumulation to help individuals achieve their financial goals.

funding_details.value: The grant covers a maximum of 30% for online marketing costs and a maximum of 20% for investment costs, implying a minimum own contribution of 70% or 80% respectively.

Non-project-specific and used goods are not eligible. Own contributions are not eligible. Vehicles and trailers (e.g., cars, trucks, buses, tractors) are generally excluded, with exceptions for mobile sales vehicles and self-propelled work machines (e.g., forklifts, mini excavators). Leasing financing is excluded, except for purchase leasing and hire-purchase.

funding_details.value: For consulting costs, the grant covers 50% of external costs, implying a minimum 50% own contribution. Funds can be used for consulting services, machinery and equipment, office and business equipment, and digitalization measures.

Companies must be classified as industrial-commercial production companies, business-related service providers, or trading companies with Styrian products in their portfolio for the specific event. Architectural firms and engineering consultants must participate in international competitions.

International trade fair appearances by Styrian companies, participation in international architectural competitions abroad by Styrian architectural firms and engineering consultants, initiation of cross-border cooperations supported by the Enterprise Europe Network (EEN), and market entry measures in European countries within a target region where the company has not yet generated significant sales.

eligibility.value: Companies that invest in the educational measures of their employees.

Eligible employees include women and men with a maximum of compulsory school leaving certificate, provided the training leads to a higher-value activity at the same workplace, a change to a higher-value workplace, improvement of basic skills (e.g., German, computer skills), completion of a certified training, technical specialization, or securing employment for at least 6 months.

Eligible employees include women with an apprenticeship certificate or a vocational middle school certificate (e.g., commercial school, three-year technical school) or AHS, provided the training leads to higher remuneration, a change to a higher-value workplace, easier re-entry after family-related career interruption, or improvement of basic skills (e.g., German, computer skills).

Eligible employees include all women and men who have completed their 50th year of life, provided the training leads to the assumption of age-appropriate activities at the workplace, a change to an age-appropriate/less strenuous workplace, adaptation to the current state of technology/knowledge, technical specialization, or improvement of basic skills (e.g., German, computer skills).
Employees must be in a fully insured or parental leave employment relationship during the training measure.
Not eligible are company owners, members of management bodies, employees in uncancelable employment relationships, apprentices, and temporary workers from commercial temporary employment agencies.

funding_details.value: Companies must co-finance 50% of the course costs, as the grant covers 50% of the course costs and 50% of personnel costs from the first course hour for employees with a maximum of compulsory school leaving certificate.

Funds can be used for courses and further training measures that last at least 16 hours, are conducted in person or live online (mixed forms are possible), and are transferable across companies. Practical training is eligible if it takes place in a training and further education institution and is separate from other operational processes.
Eligible costs include course costs and personnel costs from the first hour of the course for employees with a maximum of compulsory school leaving certificate.

description.value: This page provides information regarding the consent for the use of prospectuses for public offerings of securities. It details that public offerings of securities by Raiffeisen Bank International AG and Hypo Wohnbaubank AG through Raiffeisenbank are based on their respective valid prospectuses. Raiffeisen Bank International AG and Hypo Wohnbaubank AG have granted consent for Raiffeisenbank to use these prospectuses, subject to specific conditions. The relevant prospectuses, including supplements and consent declarations, and final terms, are accessible on the respective websites of Raiffeisen Bank International AG and Hypo Wohnbaubank AG.

legal.value: The employer is obliged to continue employing the apprentice in their learned profession for three months after the apprenticeship period (retention period / continued employment).
For the employment of foreign nationals in Austria, work may only be taken up by persons who are also entitled to stay in Austria.

legal.value: Public charges for land registry collateral amount to €4,378 (lien over €360,000) for securing the home loan.

description.value: Bpifrance, the Public Investment Bank, supports companies to grow bigger and further, offering a continuum of financing solutions from seed to stock market listing, encompassing credit and equity. Its strategic plan for 2025-2029 focuses on key priorities such as the reindustrialization of France, the decarbonization of the productive fabric, the renewal of the economy through innovation, and a massive increase in the number of supported business creators. Bpifrance mobilizes various services including guarantees, financing, innovation support, venture capital, and development capital to achieve these objectives across France, aiming to contribute to progress and build the France of tomorrow.

description.value: Horizon Europe is the EU’s key funding programme for research and innovation. It tackles climate change, helps to achieve the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals and boosts the EU’s competitiveness and growth. The programme facilitates collaboration and strengthens the impact of research and innovation in developing, supporting and implementing EU policies while tackling global challenges. It supports creating and better dispersing of excellent knowledge and technologies. It creates jobs, fully engages the EU’s talent pool, boosts economic growth, promotes industrial competitiveness and optimises investment impact within a strengthened European Research Area.

project.value: Tackles climate change, helps to achieve the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals, boosts the EU’s competitiveness and growth, facilitates collaboration and strengthens the impact of research and innovation in developing, supporting and implementing EU policies while tackling global challenges, supports creating and better dispersing of excellent knowledge and technologies, drives progress in areas such as clean aviation, the space economy, and next-generation AI.

Excellent Science (European Research Council, Marie Sklodowska-Curie Actions, Research Infrastructures), Global Challenges and European Industrial Competitiveness, Innovative Europe (European Innovation Council, European Innovation Ecosystems, European Institute of Innovation and Technology), Widening participation and strengthening the European Research Area.

Health, Culture, Creativity and Inclusive Society, Civil Security for Society, Digital, Industry and Space, Climate, Energy and Mobility, Food, Bioeconomy, Natural Resources, Agriculture and Environment. The programme also includes specific focus on civil applications, defence research and development (European Defence Fund), and nuclear fusion and fission research and training (Euratom Research and Training Programme).

description.value: The Business Angel Summit brings together selected private investors with outstanding startups from Austria in the heart of the Austrian Alps, creating prime opportunities for perfect matches. Austrian top founding teams gain a unique chance to connect with leading entrepreneurs from Tyrol and key international economic players, securing partners and potential investors. This summit aims to combine Austrian expertise with private financial support, facilitating international success for innovations by connecting promising Austrian startups with international business angels. It provides an exclusive platform for knowledge exchange, networking, and establishing future-oriented collaborations in Western Austria.

description.value: The second Horizon Europe strategic plan 2025-2027 steers research and innovation funding for the years 2025-2027, addressing key global challenges such as climate change, loss of biodiversity, the digital transition, and an ageing population. The plan sets out three strategic orientations for research and innovation investment under Horizon Europe: Green transition, Digital transition, and A more resilient, competitive, inclusive and democratic Europe. It also raises the ambition on biodiversity, committing 10% of Horizon Europe’s total budget 2025-2027 to biodiversity-related topics, complementing existing targets for climate expenditure and digital activities.

timeline.value: The strategic plan covers the years 2025-2027.

geographic_eligibility.value: The strategic plan steers research and innovation funding within and beyond Europe, for the EU's largest research and innovation (R&I) programme.

description.value: In COMET-Zentren, companies collaborate with research institutions on a multi-year research program. COMET-Zentren conduct excellent, cooperative research at a high international level and generate new research impulses. They build relevant competencies and human resources, offering diverse training and development opportunities for researchers. Successful centers are characterized by the dissemination of research results, both in the form of innovative products, processes, and services, and through high-ranking publications. COMET Centers contribute to solving societal challenges in line with the SDGs (Sustainable Development Goals) and support the transformation of the Austrian economy towards sustainable change.

eligibility.value: Researchers who would like to become self-employed with their research idea and aim to establish a startup after the fellowship has ended.

Applicants must be research institutes or companies. Applications can be submitted by research institutes in cooperation with companies. The consortium must consist of at least two project participants, one from science and one from industry. For K-Centres (COMET), the project must involve a new research topic, and its distinction from existing research programs must be demonstrated. Companies involved should not already be integrated into the competence center. Newly formed collaborations are advantageous in the evaluation process.

financial.value: Funding for scientific partners in cooperation with small and medium-sized enterprises is up to a maximum of 80% of eligible costs over the total project duration (max. 36 months). funding_details.value: The majority of project costs (at least 80%) must be borne by the research institute or researchers. Companies, as potential implementers of the results, contribute financially and through the provision of in-kind and labor services (maximum 20%) to the project.

The program contributes to addressing societal challenges and supports the transformation of the Austrian economy towards sustainable development, aligning with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

description.value: The main goal of the Mission 'A Soil Deal for Europe' is to establish 100 living labs and lighthouses to lead the transition towards healthy soils by 2030. This mission aims to fund an ambitious research and innovation programme with a strong social science component. It seeks to put in place an effective network to co-create knowledge, test solutions, and demonstrate their value in real-life conditions, while also developing a harmonised framework for soil monitoring in Europe and raising awareness on the vital importance of soils.

eligibility.value: The program calls on regions, municipalities, private or public companies, organisations, associations, schools, educational institutes, universities, research institutions, a wide range of stakeholders, and individuals to become part of the community that cares for soil.

geographic_eligibility.value: The mission focuses on EU soils and Europe.

project.value: Transition towards healthy soils, climate resilience, food systems, clean water, biodiversity, climate protection, resource efficiency.
Research and innovation programme with a strong social science component, soil monitoring.

impact.value: Promoting healthy soils, providing clean water, supporting habitats for biodiversity, contributing to climate resilience.
Supporting the basis of economy and prosperity.
Supporting cultural heritage and landscapes.

funding_details.value: Funds can be used for an ambitious research and innovation programme, establishing an effective network of 100 living labs and lighthouses, co-creating knowledge, testing solutions, demonstrating their value in real-life conditions, developing a harmonised framework for soil monitoring in Europe, and raising awareness on the vital importance of soils.

description.value: This cluster aims to fight climate change by better understanding its causes, evolution, risks, impacts and opportunities, and by making the energy and transport sectors more climate and environment-friendly, more efficient and competitive, smarter, safer and more resilient. The expected impacts of this cluster are contained in the Horizon Europe strategic plan. It covers various intervention areas including climate science, energy supply, energy systems, buildings, communities, industrial competitiveness in transport, clean and smart mobility, and energy storage.

geographic_eligibility.value: Organisations and entities based in EU member states and associated countries are eligible to participate in calls under this cluster.

description.value: The European Innovation Council (EIC) promotes breakthrough innovation with scale-up potential at the global level. It focuses mainly on breakthrough, deeptech and disruptive innovation, targeting especially market-creating innovation. The EIC also supports strategic technology and innovation challenges which will take into account the priorities of the Horizon Europe strategic plan. It offers Pathfinder, Transition, and Accelerator funding, along with prizes, fellowships, and business added-value services.

description.value: This Mission tackles one of our most pressing challenges-restoring the health of the ocean, seas, and inland waters-by 2030. Through research and innovation, public engagement, and targeted blue investments, this Mission takes a systemic approach to protect and restore marine and freshwater ecosystems and biodiversity, prevent and eliminate pollution, and make the sustainable blue economy carbon-neutral and circular. It operates through area-based “lighthouses” in major sea and river basins across Europe, serving as living labs for demonstrating and scaling solutions. A central part is the Mission Charter, inviting stakeholders to pledge concrete actions, and a Digital Twin Ocean is being developed for real-time monitoring and predictive analysis. The Mission aims to engage and empower a wide range of stakeholders, including public and private organisations, national, regional and local actors, communities, businesses, and citizens.

eligibility.value: Member States, regions, cities, and stakeholders are invited to pledge concrete actions that support the Mission’s objectives. The Mission engages and empowers a wide range of stakeholders, including public and private organisations, national, regional and local actors, coastal, riparian, islands communities, businesses, and citizens.

project.value: Restoring the health of the ocean, seas, and inland waters; protecting and restoring marine and freshwater ecosystems and biodiversity; preventing and eliminating pollution of our ocean, seas and waters; making the sustainable blue economy carbon-neutral and circular.

Digital Twin Ocean (innovative, virtual representation designed to integrate a vast array of data and simulate the effects of different actions on marine and freshwater ecosystems and predict future scenarios, enabling real-time monitoring, predictive analysis, and better-informed decision-making).
Marine and freshwater ecosystems, sustainable blue economy.

timeline.value: Goals to be achieved by 2030.
Open deadline (rolling application)

geographic_eligibility.value: Implementation across Europe, and beyond, with area-based “lighthouses” in major sea and river basins: Atlantic-Arctic, Mediterranean Sea, Baltic-North Sea, and Danube-Black Sea. Member States, regions, and cities are invited to participate.

impact.value: Restoring the health of the ocean, seas, and inland waters; protecting and restoring marine and freshwater ecosystems and biodiversity; preventing and eliminating pollution of our ocean, seas and waters; making the sustainable blue economy carbon-neutral and circular.

Public engagement and empowerment of a wide range of stakeholders, including public and private organisations, national, regional and local actors, coastal, riparian, islands communities, businesses, and citizens to actively participate in shaping the future of Europe's marine and freshwater ecosystem.

Through research and innovation, demonstrating, deploying and scaling up solutions; developing a Digital Twin Ocean for real-time monitoring, predictive analysis, and better-informed decision-making for sustainable management of marine and freshwater ecosystems.

description.value: Widening Participation and Spreading Excellence actions under Horizon Europe contribute to building research and innovation capacity for countries lagging behind. They aim to strengthen their potential for successful participation in transnational research and innovation processes, promote networking and access to excellence. Participants in the programme will be able to upgrade their research and innovation systems, making them stronger and allowing the EU as a whole to advance together, in line with the policy objectives of the European Research Area.

eligibility.value: Research institutions, universities, higher education institutions, academia, businesses, governments and civil society organisations.

Organisations from Widening countries (countries lagging behind in research and innovation performance) are eligible. Research institutions of the Widening countries can act as coordinators, partnering with top-class leading counterparts at EU level. Alliances of higher education institutions are also eligible.

funding_details.value: Teaming actions require the conditionality of securing complementary investment from structural funds or other sources.

geographic.value: Widening countries (countries lagging behind in research and innovation performance), EU countries or Associated Countries.

team.value: ERA Chairs aim to establish a research team fully integrated in the coordinator's institution. project.value: Focus areas include building research and innovation capacity, fostering transnational research and innovation processes, promoting networking and access to excellence, upgrading research and innovation systems, raising excellence in science and value creation, supporting cross-border collaboration, improving knowledge diffusion, technology uptake and spill-over effects, and strengthening regional innovation excellence through innovation ecosystems.

ITER’s operation scenarios should be tested to ensure they are robust and have the required performance, requiring a broad experimental programme on existing fusion devices and an extensive analysis and simulation programme.
Gradual shift from physics to technology to achieve the goal of completing a conceptual demo design and starting the transition to an engineering design phase.

description.value: This program, offered by Austria Wirtschaftsservice (aws), provides special funding initiatives in response to the Ukraine war. It aims to support businesses affected by the crisis or to help them adapt to new economic conditions. The program likely includes various financial instruments to ensure economic stability and resilience in Austria.

The European Commission continues its activities in supporting small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and Small Mid Caps in overcoming their financing problems through the InvestEU Fund. This follows the very successful implementation of previous EU programs like COSME, InnovFin, and others under the European Fund for Strategic Investments. The InvestEU-Rückhaftungsfazilität (InvestEU Guarantee Facility) is currently available to provide this support.

description.value: The Vienna Neighbourhood Initiative (Grätzelinitiative Wien) provides funding for micro-enterprises, small businesses and entrepreneurs who provide goods and services aimed at meeting the daily needs of their local neighbourhood. It supports the conversion of ground floor premises located in specific project areas in Vienna’s 16th and 2nd/20th districts. Commercial premises are allocated by the Vienna Business Agency at 50% subsidised subletting rates. The initiative aims to help businesses convert their premises or gain more customer visibility within these urban renewal areas.

description.value: The BRIDGE 2024/1 funding program, offered by FFG, is designed to support fundamental research-oriented projects with a clear potential for commercial exploitation. It promotes collaboration between scientific research institutions and the exploiting industry, welcoming consortia from all disciplines and sectors in Austria. The program encourages the integration of young researchers into projects. While generally open to various themes and technologies, it specifically excludes clinical studies as a primary focus, though pilot clinical studies can be partially funded.

description.value: The Framework Programme for SME Competitiveness (COSME) is an EU initiative designed to help small and medium-sized enterprises (SME) overcome financial problems by mobilising loans and equity investments. Operating from 2014 to 2020, the program provides support through two main facilities: the Loan Guarantee Fund (LGF) and the Equity Facility for Growth (EFG). Austrian companies can access COSME through financial intermediaries like aws, which offers guarantees and counter-guarantees to facilitate access to loan financing and venture capital, thereby reducing guarantee fees for eligible businesses. This program aims to support SMEs in their expansion and growth phases.

description.value: Horizon Europe is an ambitious research and innovation programme proposed by the European Commission to succeed Horizon 2020. It aims to fund and support research and innovation activities across the European Union. The program's total budget was politically agreed at €95.5 billion, including funds from the Next Generation of the EU – Recovery Fund, to drive innovation-led growth and address key societal challenges.

description.value: The European Research Council (ERC), established by the EU in 2007, is the leading European funding organization for excellent frontier research. It offers attractive and flexible funding to talented and creative individual researchers, with a focus on early-stage researchers and their teams, to explore promising avenues at the forefront of science. Selection is based solely on excellence through EU-wide competition, and ERC grantees have contributed to advancements in new technological fields, including clean and digital technologies, aligning with Horizon Europe's strategic priorities.

eligibility.value: Talented and creative individual researchers and their teams are eligible to apply. Competition is EU-wide and based solely on the criterion of excellence.

description.value: Research infrastructures are facilities that provide resources and services for the research communities to conduct research and foster innovation in their fields. Horizon Europe aims to endow Europe with world-class sustainable research infrastructures which are open and accessible to the best researchers from Europe and beyond. The program encourages the use of existing research infrastructures, including those financed from funds under the EU's Cohesion Policy. This initiative enhances the potential of research infrastructures to support scientific advance and innovation, enabling open and excellent science in accordance with the FAIR principles, and contributing to EU policies and international cooperation.

description.value: The main goal of the Mission 'A Soil Deal for Europe' is to establish 100 living labs and lighthouses to lead the transition towards healthy soils by 2030. Life on earth depends on healthy soils, which are the foundation of our food systems, provide clean water and habitats for biodiversity, and contribute to climate resilience. This Mission funds an ambitious research and innovation programme with a strong social science component to co-create knowledge, test solutions, and demonstrate their value in real-life conditions. It also aims to develop a harmonised framework for soil monitoring in Europe and raise awareness on the vital importance of soils.

eligibility.value: Companies must be based in Austria, Germany, or EU member states with headquarters in Vienna

geographic_eligibility.value: Organisations and individuals across Europe, focusing on EU soils.

application.value: Stakeholders and individuals are called to sign the Mission Soil Manifesto and become part of a community that cares for soil. Further funding opportunities and open calls related to the mission can be explored on the Funding and Tenders Portal.

description.value: The EU Cancer Mission, alongside Europe's Beating Cancer Plan, represents the European Commission's strategy to reverse the alarming trend of cancer diagnoses and deaths. It unites research, innovation, and public health policies to generate new evidence and foster innovative concepts. By investing in research and collaborating with citizens and stakeholders, the Mission aims to inform policy actions across its key objectives: understanding cancer, prevention and early detection, diagnosis and treatment, and improving quality of life. The ultimate goal is to improve the lives of more than 3 million people by 2030 through prevention, cure, and better living for those affected by cancer and their families.

timeline.value: The mission aims to improve the lives of more than 3 million people by 2030.

geographic_eligibility.value: The EU Cancer Mission is a European Commission strategy, implying a focus on the European Union and its member states.

project.value: The mission focuses on understanding cancer, prevention and early detection, diagnosis and treatment, and improving quality of life. Cross-cutting themes include citizen and stakeholder engagement, equitable access, childhood cancer, innovation, and personalised medicine.
Cancer research and public health policies.

impact.value: Improve the lives of more than 3 million people by 2030, through prevention, cure and for those affected by cancer including their families, to live longer and better. It addresses the tremendous burden for patients, families, and societies at large and aims to tackle unequal access to screening and care.

funding_details.value: Funds are used for investing in research, generating new evidence, and fostering innovative concepts to inform policy actions across the mission's objectives.

description.value: EU Missions are large-scale initiatives under Horizon Europe setting clear, time-bound goals that drive focused efforts towards some of our greatest challenges such as climate change, cancer, ocean restoration, soil health, and the development of climate-neutral and smart cities. By bringing together researchers, policymakers, citizens, and stakeholders, EU Missions pool the necessary resources to drive innovation and deliver concrete solutions for societal benefit. These missions are a novelty of the Horizon Europe research and innovation programme for 2021-2027.

timeline.value: The EU Missions are part of the Horizon Europe research and innovation programme for 2021-2027.

geographic_eligibility.value: Initiatives focused on European challenges, aiming to involve European communities, cities, and stakeholders across Europe.

project.value: Climate change adaptation, cancer prevention and cure, climate-neutral and smart cities, soil health, and ocean and water restoration.
Adaptation to climate change, cancer research and care, urban development and smart cities, sustainable agriculture and soil health, and marine and freshwater ecosystem restoration.

impact.value: Aiming to guide at least 150 communities through understanding climate risks, developing pathways for preparation, and implementing innovative solutions by 2030; establishing 100 living labs and lighthouses to lead the transition towards healthy soils by 2030; protecting and restoring our ocean and waters through innovation and action by 2030; and delivering 100 climate-neutral and smart cities by 2030.
Improving the lives of more than 3 million people by 2030 through prevention, cure and for those affected by cancer including their families, to live longer and better.

funding_details.value: Funds are pooled to drive innovation and deliver concrete solutions for societal benefit, addressing major challenges such as climate change, cancer, ocean restoration, soil health, and the development of climate-neutral and smart cities.

description.value: The European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT) is an independent EU body that aims to increase Europe’s ability to innovate by nurturing entrepreneurial talent and supporting new ideas. It contributes to the 4 key strategic orientations in the Horizon Europe strategic plan. Through its Pillar III ‘Innovative Europe’, the programme focuses on supporting the development of disruptive and market-creating innovations and on enhancing European innovation ecosystems.

description.value: This part of the Horizon Europe programme focuses on reforming and enhancing the European Research and Innovation system. It aims to mutually reinforce and complement national policy reforms through EU-level policy initiatives, research, networking, partnering, coordination, data collection, and monitoring and evaluation. The program supports various activities to strengthen the European Research Area, including evidence-based policy making, foresight, open science, and research career development. All specific funding information and application details are available on the Funding and Tenders portal.

eligibility.value: The program provides support for policy makers, funding bodies, research performing organisations (including universities), or advisory groups working on the European Research Area and related policies.

geographic.value: The program focuses on EU-level policy initiatives and strengthening the European Research Area.

project.value: The program focuses on strengthening the evidence base for research and innovation policy, foresight activities, accelerating the transition towards open science, supporting synergies between research and innovation and higher education policies and programmes, and strengthening research careers.
The program supports research and innovation policy, open science, and higher education, research, and innovation.

funding_details.value: Funds can be used for the development of EU-level policy initiatives, research, networking, partnering, coordination, data collection, monitoring and evaluation, strengthening the evidence base for research and innovation policy, foresight activities, support for policy makers, funding bodies, research performing organisations (including universities) or advisory groups, monitoring, analysing and supporting the development and uptake of open science policies and practices, support for synergies between research and innovation and higher education policies and programmes, support for interconnected knowledge ecosystems, and strengthening research careers.

description.value: Collective Research supports pre-competitive research projects which do not include any directly exploitable product and process or service developments. The program targets interest groups and non-university research institutions, with research work carried out by research institutions. Its objectives include increasing the international competitiveness of Austrian industries, strengthening the knowledge base of Austrian companies (primarily SMEs), and developing innovative solutions for common problems.

description.value: European Partnerships are strategic instruments within Horizon Europe, enabling long-term collaboration between the EU, private, and public partners. They address Europe’s pressing challenges through concerted research and innovation initiatives, contributing to EU political priorities like the green and digital transitions. By pooling resources, these partnerships aim to avoid duplication of investments and reduce fragmentation in the EU's research and innovation landscape.

Applicants must be scientists who aim to implement their research projects with the potential for significant societal, environmental, or economic changes and found a spin-off. The project should have the potential to bring about significant changes in technologies, markets, or society. Hurdles and risks beyond technological challenges (e.g., legal ambiguities, adaptation of user behavior, new market) are expected in the implementation. Fellows must have the ambition and potential to achieve a great impact for a large target group, such as international implementation.

description.value: Horizon Europe is the EU's flagship research and innovation program for 2021-2027, designed to drive economic and societal benefits across Europe. It funds a wide range of projects, supports scientific excellence, and fosters innovation, particularly for startups and scaleups through initiatives like the European Innovation Council (EIC) Fund. The program aims to address EU policy priorities and global challenges, strengthen human capital in research and innovation, and promote the diffusion of knowledge.

description.value: Do you have a project idea and are interested in funding? The FFG-Förderservice helps you quickly find the right funding program and provides clear, tailored information. We are also available for questions regarding eCall project administration. Learn about FFG's funding offerings and use smart search and filter functions to find suitable programs. The service also offers a QuickCheck for rapid feedback on potential funding programs and a 'Förderpilot*in' to search federal and state funding, including FFG programs.

geographic_eligibility.value: The FFG (Österreichische Forschungsförderungsgesellschaft) is the national funding institution for business-related research and development in Austria, implying the service is primarily for entities based in Austria. However, it also provides an overview of European and international funding programs, services, and consulting offers.

project.value: The service is designed for individuals or organizations with an innovative project idea who are seeking funding.

application.value: The service helps users find the right funding program, understand the FFG's funding offerings, use search and filter functions, and get feedback via QuickCheck and Förderpilot*in. It also provides information on how to prepare for a consultation and how to apply for funding programs, including guidance on the FFG eCall tool for registration and login issues, and details on project accounting and eligible costs.

They involve creating transformative Research & Innovation programmes to strengthen resilience, fairness, inclusiveness, and social cohesion in response to various societal changes.

Deploying and consolidating an open, trusted virtual environment for research data (EOSC); modernising the European Research Area (ERA) with FAIR-by-design datasets; expanding FAIR data culture; accelerating deployment of new solutions to market; fostering emergence and deployment of new innovative solutions; creating and developing companies; driving digital innovation and entrepreneurial talent; promoting innovation for healthier lives; developing a highly skilled food sector with new products, services, and technologies; transforming industrial production towards knowledge-intensive, sustainable, low-emission, trans-sectoral manufacturing; boosting competitiveness, growth, and attractiveness of the European raw materials sector via radical innovation, new educational approaches, and entrepreneurship; improving competitiveness and innovation capabilities in cultural and creative industries by fostering talent, supporting innovative solutions, and accelerating companies.
